intro: Schrebera chevalieri, commonly known as the Malagasy star apple, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to a star fruit, hence its common name. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and floral display. Schrebera chevalieri is adapted to tropical climates and thrives in well-drained soil with ample sunlight.
